idea-plugin.name: Hot Folder
idea-plugin.description:
Hot Folder plugin allows you to add shared folders from anywhere on your file system to your IDE workspace.

Features

  • Add multiple hot folders to your project
  • Dedicated tool window that can be positioned anywhere
  • Browse and navigate folder contents directly in the IDE
  • Automatic refresh when files change
  • Double-click to open files
  • Context menu with file operations (New, Copy, Paste, Delete, etc.)
  • Settings page to manage hot folders

Use Cases

  • Share common libraries or resources between multiple projects
  • Quick access to frequently used external directories
  • Keep reference documentation or templates visible while working
  • Access shared team resources without copying them into each project

How to Use

  1. Open the Hot Folders tool window (usually on the right side)
  2. Click the + button in the toolbar to add a folder
  3. Browse and select the folder you want to add
  4. The folder will appear in the tool window with all its contents

You can also manage hot folders via Settings → Tools → Hot Folders
